sub_topic: Probability of winning a game of chance
message_1: Suppose that you are playing a game of chance at a carnival where you have to select a card from a deck of 52 cards. The game operator will give you a prize if you choose the ace of hearts. What is the probability of winning the game if you get only one chance to select a card?
message_2:
There is only one ace of hearts in a standard deck of 52 cards. Therefore, the probability of selecting the ace of hearts in one chance is 1 out of 52. 

The probability can be expressed as a fraction, decimal, or percentage:

Fraction: 1/52
Decimal: 0.01923 (rounded to 5 decimal places)
Percentage: 1.923% (rounded to 3 decimal places)
